name: Mint Chutney
history: Mint Chutney, also known as Pudina Chutney, is a staple in Indian cuisine. It's a versatile condiment that has been enjoyed for centuries, known for its refreshing taste and compatibility with a variety of Indian dishes.
description: Mint Chutney is a vibrant and flavorful condiment made from fresh mint leaves, coriander leaves, green chilies, and various seasonings. It's characterized by its bright green color and refreshing, tangy taste, often accompanied by a hint of sweetness.

equipment.name: blender or food processor
equipment.description: For blending the ingredients into a smooth paste.

instructions.title: Prepare the Ingredients
instructions.description: Wash the mint and coriander leaves. Remove the stems and roughly chop the leaves.

instructions.title: Blend
instructions.description: In a blender or food processor, combine the mint leaves, coriander leaves, green chilies, lemon juice, ginger, garlic, cumin seeds, salt, sugar (if using), and a little water. Blend to a smooth paste.

instructions.title: Adjust Consistency
instructions.description: Add more water if needed to achieve the desired consistency of the chutney.

instructions.title: Serve or Store
instructions.description: Serve the chutney immediately or store it in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

tips: Adjust the number of green chilies based on your spice preference.
Lemon juice not only adds flavor but also helps in preserving the green color of the chutney.
variations: Include yogurt for a creamier version of the chutney.
Add roasted peanuts or sesame seeds for a nutty flavor.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 1 week.
storage.instructions: Store in a clean, airtight glass container in the refrigerator.

presentationTips: Serve in a small traditional Indian condiment dish.
Garnish with a sprig of mint for a fresh look.
